intro: Teucrium angustissimum var. expassum, commonly known as the narrowleaf germander, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It typically grows in rocky or limestone soils, often in open habitats such as grasslands and woodlands. The plant features slender, upright stems with opposite, narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, tubular flowers are typically blue to purple in color, arranged in dense clusters at the ends of the branches. This variety is noted for its aromatic foliage and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
